config_description: /** * Database setting MAX_COMPACT_TIME (default: 200). * The maximum time in milliseconds used to compact a database when closing. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'LOB_TIMEOUT' is used in the code to set the maximum time in milliseconds used to compact a database when closing. It is used to determine when to remove temporary lobs based on the timeout value.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration 'LOB_TIMEOUT' is triggered whenever the 'removeTemporaryLobs' method is called in the system. The frequency of triggering depends on how often this method is invoked.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'LOB_TIMEOUT' configuration option is that it determines how long temporary lobs are kept before being removed. Setting a higher timeout value may result in temporary lobs being kept for a longer period, potentially increasing memory usage. On the other hand, setting a lower timeout value may result in temporary lobs being removed more frequently, potentially affecting performance.
